info.name: HelpWanted3613Project
info.description:
### **Ensure the \[host\] collection variable is set before running collection tests.**

Running the Login routes for either Staff, Employer or Student will automatically store the generated token in the \[accessToken\] variable.

When running requests individually, ensure you first run Login Staff before running staff routes, or Login Employer before running employer routes, or Login Student before running student routes, as routes are protected based on role.

item.name: Initialize
item.description: Contains the initialize route which runs before all other requests during a collection run.

request.description: Lists all Students and their respective details, such as: IDs, usernames, emails, degrees, resumes and GPAs.

response.name: Success

variable.description: The ID of the student to view

request.description: Returns the details of a Student user with the given Student ID.

variable.description: The ID of the student to view

The ID of the student to shortlist

request.description:
Allows a Staff to shortlist a student for a position, given a Position and Student ID.  
This updates an Application and sets its state to "SHORTLISTED".

exec: pm.test("State is ACCEPTED or REJECTED", function () {

variable.description: The ID of the position for which the decision is being made

request.description:
Allows an employer to accept or reject a shortlisted Student, given a Position ID.

This updates an Application and sets its state to either "ACCEPTED" or "REJECTED" and optionally includes a response message.

variable.description: The ID of the position for which the decision is being made
The ID of the position for which the decision is being made

exec: pm.test("positionData field types are correct", function () {

variable.description: The ID of the position to open/close

request.description:
Allows an Employer to change a Positions status to open or closed, given the Position ID.

This updates a Position and sets its status to either "open" or "closed".

response.name: Success: Open

variable.description: The ID of the position to open/close

response.name: Success: Close

variable.description: The ID of the position to open/close

exec: pm.test("Application field types are correct", function () {

request.description: Lists all applications relevant to the logged-in student where they have been shortlisted, accepted, or rejected.
Returns the employers decision and response message for a specific application, given the Position ID.

response.name: Success
response.body:
{
    "ApplicationID": 17,
    "Company": "CompanyOne",
    "Employer": "Frank",
    "Employer Response": "Your passion for robotics has earned you a spot in our team. We look forward to hearing from you soon.",
    "Position": "Research Assistant",
    "Status": "ACCEPTED"
}
